Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I had a mastectomy on 3rd March and the scar is very lumpy.  I saw the consultant who said she would repair it under local anaesthetic - one end is like a mini breast, the size a young girl gets at puberty and the other end has three small fleshy lumps.  I wonder if anyone knows how long this repair takes to heal and whether I can drive when it's been done.  All info gratefully received. thank you!
Posts.Title: repair to lumpy scar

Posts.Content: My Discharge summary following the mastectomy says " Malignant Lesion of Breast B8250". I have no idea what B8250 means and didn't spot it until I got home (brain having gone awol after the op!)  Can anyone help?  Many thanks
Posts.Title: understanding discharge summary

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, Today (3 weeks to the day after right sided mastectomy) I tried driving my car. I found it rather uncomfortable but bearable - until I tried to parallel park! That was hard. So I guess I need to wait a few more days.  Also I am finding that I am so tired - more so than a week ago.  The cording in my arm is painful but that's not it - I think perhaps I just have to accept that recovery doesn't go in a straight line but in fits and starts.  Does anyone out there have tips about dealing with cording and about when driving becomes easier?
Posts.Title: Feels as if I am going backwards a bit

Posts.Content: Hi -I think you replied to my query about haematoma but all I got was the letter y!!! Maybe you didn't mean to send to me?
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: I empathise completely! I had mastectomy ten days ago and was terrified, especially as I have a fear of vomiting post anaesthetic. I told the anaesthetist and he took precautions and I wasn't sick. Eveyrone was so kind; when I came round a friendly nurse was there and didn't leave me.  I was due to stay in for one night but opted for an extra night as I live alone and also was feeling faint whenever I got up for the loo. When I was discharged on day after I was fine.  It wasn't nearly as bad as I feared; and the pain was more discomfort than pain.  Good luck -
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: I am posting this because I had read on various sites and forums about how painful the injection into the breast prior to surgery was.  I had mine today (surgery tomorrow) and to be totally honest, I hardly felt a thing. Certainly no worse than a wasp sting and over in a nanosecond. So if you are due one, please don't worry!
Posts.Title: radioactive injection

Posts.Content: Thank you - it's so reassuring to have this forum to share silly worries and good moments - thank you all
Posts.Title: radioactive injection

Posts.Content: Hello, it's me again - apologies.  It's 2 a.m. and I came home from hospital yesterday afternoon following mastectomy. I had an anti clotting injection in my stomach and tonight my gums are bleeding heavily. I mean heavily - I get bleeding gums anyway but this is something else and I can only put it down to the effects of the anti clotting.  Of course, being a bit tired, rather sore and on my own I am worrying that other bits of me will start bleeding!  In daylight this will seem foolish I am sure, but if anyone has any advice/warnings, please share them.  Should I tell anyone about the bleeding tonight?
Posts.Title: bleeding in mouth following anti clotting injection

Posts.Content: I am so lucky to have had the all clear following my mastectomy that I feel guilty even thinking of bothering anyone with another question.  My incision is bleeding slightly today (still have steri strips/glue in place.  Is this a worry or should I just leave it? It's no much and only at one end of the incision.  I do have a haematoma and a seroma but just wondered whether I need to do anything about the slight bleed. Thanks
Posts.Title: Bleeding from incision

Posts.Content: I wonder if anyone can throw light on this? I had extensive bruising after my mastectomy on 3 March and the consultant remarked on how severe it was - spreading right down to my waist. (I had an anti coagulant injection before discharge and have always had trouble with my blood clotting - nosebleeds in the past, bleeding gums etc).  Anyway, over the past two days I have noticed large bruises in my pubic area as well as one near my right hip.  Should I mention this to anyone? O r wait till I see the breast care nurse next time?
Posts.Title: new bruising one week on

Posts.Content: That's a though!  It hadn't crossed my mind. Thank you
Posts.Title: new bruising one week on

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone. I saw BCN and registrar and both said they thought it was as a result of (a) the fact that I bleed very easily and (b) natural drainage.  Neither were unduly concerned but said if it continues to spread and the haematoma gets larger, to get in touch again. Very reassured. Thank you
Posts.Title: new bruising one week on

Posts.Content: Today I had my drain removed - hallelujah! While talking to the breast care nurse, she said that when I return for the results of my sentinel node biopsy and follow up in a week's time, I should "go with an open mind" because if the sentinel node has traces of cancer, I may need further surgery. I had thought that radiotherapy would be the next step, and hadn't had surgery mentioned before.  Could anyone enlighten me as to probability etc?  I am staying positive but like to get my head round things in advance.
Posts.Title: They didn't say this before!
